## JsonEditor class

The JsonEditor can be used to edit JSON objects in place or to clone any JSON value, applying a default context and optional set of editor rules that were supplied at initialization.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class JsonEditor implements IJsonCloneEditor 
```
**Implements:** IJsonCloneEditor

|  [getDefaultRules(options)](./ts-json.jsoneditor.getdefaultrules.md) | <code>static</code> | Gets the default set of rules to be applied for a given set of options. By default, all available rules (templates, conditionals, multi-value and references) are applied. |
|  [mergeObjectInPlace(target, src, runtimeContext)](./ts-json.jsoneditor.mergeobjectinplace.md) |  | Merges a supplied source object into a supplied target, updating the target object. |

|  [mergeObjectsInPlaceWithContext(context, base, srcObjects)](./ts-json.jsoneditor.mergeobjectsinplacewithcontext.md) |  | Merges multiple supplied source objects into a supplied target, updating the target object and using an optional context supplied in the call. |
